DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicates why there is no data regarding negative cutaneous melanoma surgical margins.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cutaneous Melanoma Negative Surgical Margin Missing Value Reason
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm derived from cells that are capable of forming melanin.:definition pending_A specific reason explaining why a meaningful value is not available.  A meaningful value answers the question posed by a Data Element Concept.  In contrast, a Missing Value Reason answers the implicit question "Why is there no 'meaningful' value?", when there is none.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm derived from cells that are capable of forming melanin.:definition pending

Concepts.definition: A primary melanoma arising from atypical melanocytes in the skin.  Precursor lesions include acquired and congenital melanocytic nevi, and dysplastic nevi.  Several histologic variants have been recognized, including superficial spreading melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, nodular melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma.
Indicates the absence of tumor cells at the edge of a surgically excised specimen.

In contrast, a Missing Value Reason answers the implicit question "Why is there no 'meaningful' value?", when there is none.
